intro: Phaca platytropis, commonly known as the broad-leaved phaca, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. Phaca platytropis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
